metadata.name: Ruconest 2100 U 1 Injection powder for solution

clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the treatment of acute attacks of hereditary angioedema HAE due to C1 esterase inhibitor deficiency in adults

contraindications.disease: The common adverse reactions 2 reported in clinical trials were headache nausea and diarrhea Serious arterial and venous thromboembolic TE events have been reported at the recommended dose of plasma derived C1 esterase inhibitor products in patients with risk factors Risk factors may include the presence of an indwelling venous catheter access device prior history of thrombosis underlying atherosclerosis use of oral contraceptives or certain androgens morbid obesity and immobility Monitor patients with known risk factors for TE events during and after administration
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: A dose of 50 U kg of Ruconest increases plasma C1INH activity levels to greater than 0 7 U mL the lower limit of normal in HAE patients

incompatibilities.description: The risk or severity of thromboembolism can be increased when Etonogestrel is combined with Conestat alfa
